column4: I installed libboost-dev-all, the boost libraries are present in /usr/includes/ but trying to compile the example
pastebin your command and the full output
ex1.cpp:36: error: ‘client::qi::double_’ has not been declared
ex1.cpp:43: error: ‘double_’ was not declared in this scope
I imagine you want to read the beginning of the documentation where it tells you how to invoke g++
from #boost...... [13:02:17] <olx69> Mardoxx:copy 1:1 compiles on my box
ask him what command he ran to compile it...
I think it's a version mismatch, the example is from 1.42, the ubuntu version is 1.40
[13:19:19] <kalven> Mardoxx: what I mean is, if you take an example from 1.42, it might not work in 1.40?
yeah, you're right, it compiles fine here as well with no options given to g++
howcome my package mamager says the latest version is 1.40? how can I make it install the latest?
